Stephen King wrote a memoir called "On Writing: A Memoir of the Craft."

I discussed this topic in a blog post for Harvard Business Review.

The post is titled "The One Thing CEOs Need to Learn from Apple."

It was published on April 30, 2012.

King also wrote a third foreword to "Ibid."

Alan D. Williams wrote, “What Is an Editor?”

This is in "Editors on Editing: What Writers Need to Know About What Editors Do."

It is the third revised edition, edited by Gerald Gross.

This book was published in New York by Grove Press in 1993.

Some minor details changed.

This is based on a talk by Clayton Christensen.

He gave this talk to students at Stanford Law School in 2013.

Henry Cloud and John Townsend wrote "Boundaries: When to Say Yes, How to Say No."

This book was published by Zondervan in Grand Rapids, MI, in 1992.

I found this story cited in several places.

For example, it appears in Jill Rigby’s "Raising Respectful Children in an Unrespectful World."

This book was published by Simon & Schuster in New York in 2006.

It is in chapter 6.

However, I have not found an original source for the story.

Therefore, I share this only as an anecdote.

Guy Lodge wrote "Thatcher and North Sea Oil: A Failure to Invest in Britain’s Future."

This article appeared in New Statesman on April 15, 2013.

Dale Hurd wrote "Save or Spend? Norway’s Commonsense Example."

This article was published by CBN News on July 11, 2011.

Richard Milne wrote "Debate Heralds Change for Norway’s Oil Fund."
